comment: Dr. Fox's lectures by weaving history into a very interesting story, which makes the time pass quickly. There are several T/F quizzes on the previous class lecture material, 4 exams (final is not cumulative). Exams are from the lecture notes and a study guide. You will get out of it what YOU put into it. He is very fair and reasonable.

Dr. Fox knows what he's talking about. The multiple choice portion of his test come straight from his lecture and they're not hard questions at all, but he does include 4 free response questions that will hurt you if you don't go into detail on them. 4 map tests over Middle East, Asia, Africa, and Latin America. Pop quizzes are over  past lectures.

Go to every class and take really good notes and you should be fine! test are pretty hard but not anything crazy. Pop quizzes are just T/F. key is to go to class and take detailed notes and youll pass.

He is kind of a tough grader but I loved him! Attendance isn't mandatory but I suggest you go. His lectures take up most of class, but he isn't boring. I suggest you just take notes, do the homework (which is not a lot and it's super easy), and study for the tests and you'll do fine! I would definitely take him again.
I struggled in this class. Lecture based class and tests are online with lockdown browser. Lots of online homework that takes forever. Hated this class

Extremely smart man, and lectures are clear cut and informative. But quizzes and tests are tough. Book is not needed, as all you need for the tests come from the lectures. Strict on attendance and no phones. It's not an impossible class, but don't be like me and blow it off and expect to pass. You won't. Work for the grade you want, and it'll come.

A very knowledgeable professor. The class expectations are very clear.  If you pay attention to his lectures, and review your notes you will be fine. He offers a lot of filler grades  to boost your grade.

This class is not as bad as everyone says. No, its not easy. But as long as you take fairly extensive notes on your computer during class you'll do fine. He gives extra credit, hw completion grades, few pop quizzes, and simple map tests. You don't really have to read the book, just the readings he gives for the test online. He is extremely smart.

It appears most people do not like Dr. Fox because his class is difficult. Personally I liked him. His lectures are exceptionally interesting. If you simply listen closely to them and pay attention to the study guides you will be able to pass. If you need help you can ask after class and you will receive it. Attendance is mandatory!

His tests are seriously impossible.. He has an extensive knowledge of world history but expects you to as well, which I clearly didn't have since this was a "basic" world history class. DO NOT TAKE HIM unless you plan to major in history.

DR. Fox was one of the worst professors I have had in college. He lectures and expects you to know stuff that wasn't gone over. When you go to him to ask for help, he expects you to know the answer to your own question and looks at you like you are stupid if you don't. He is no help to the student. Pop quizzes almost everyday. Tests are impossible.

If you want a super hard gen ed course, this is the guy to take. He is bitterly sarcastic and is not afraid to call you out or make rude comments if need be. His tests are extremely hard and detailed and very test has like 35-40 multiple choice questions and 4 little essays. There are also multiple map tests. If you don't read, you won't do well.
Funny guy, lots of lectures, hard tests
He's an okay prof. Be prepared to write essays. He lectures and doesn't put his pp online so attendance is mandatory. Summer semester only consisted of a midterm, 6-pg essay and final.

The class is hard but if you make sure you study, read the sections from the book, take notes, and work on the study guides then you should have no problem passing. He is sarcastic but he knows what he is talking about. I had three test with the last one containing an essay, 9 quizzes but he drops the lowest one, and 5 map tests.

This is an extremely hard class for gen ed. Tests come straight from his lectures, so be sure not to miss a class or have a second where you're not paying attention. He's kind of sarcastic. Lectures were hard to pay attention to. Gives 4 bonus points to final grade if you miss less than 5 classes. Pop quizzes almost every day.

Class is very interesting. Show up to lectures, adds 4 extra points to your final grade if you don't miss more than 4 days. Everything is pretty straight forward. Doesn't really care too much about his students but lets you know what you need to do. Very blunt and straight forward kinda guy. Enjoyed his lectures. Read the book and listen to pass.

Extremely hard! Lectures are one of a kind! He is a great story teller- sincere and even theatrical. You'll never be bored. 13 reading quizzes!!! A lot of reading, not just "looking through". Attendance is a must and he is quite generous, giving extra 4 points for that. His power points are great and you can get easily prepared for the exams.

For a history class this class is more in-depth than I thought it would be. I only expected it to be a breeze. Make sure you read the chapters for the pop reading quizzes that he does for  many classes. And study the study guide for the tests not just for vocab. purposes but for significance. Study hard and you should pass!

If you want a teacher that doesn't care about his students, this is your man. Reading homework for every class and surprise quizzes. Lectures are mandatory as no information is posted online. Tests are very difficult. He is unapproachable and will openly insult you if he finds it necessary. Don't take him.

Lectures everyday, usually a pop quiz on assigned reading every other class, very easy and straight from the book. Lectures are pretty freaking important, and usually gives extra credit if you don't miss class. He can be funny or sarcastic, overall fair teacher. Drops lowest exam and some quizes. Decent class. Still have to study lots. Good prof.
